Posts.Title: Sister in England in hospital with cellulitis

Posts.Content: Hello, everyone: I'm the one with the sister in England who has been having non-stop complications since her lumpectomy and radiation a year ago.  Back in April she was hospitalized for 8 days with cellulitis.  Now she has another infection!  She saw her breast surgeon a week ago; he did an ultrasound, saw something suspicious and aspirated some nasty-looking fluid.  It turns out that what they thought was scar tissue on her last mammogram was in fact this infection, which has probably been brewing for a long time.
Posts.Title: Sister in England: update

Posts.Content: Hi again, everyone: it's been a while since I last posted.  My younger sister (45) lives in London and was diagnosed a year ago, had a lumpectomy and radiation and is currently on Tamoxifen.  Her latest mammogram two weeks ago was clear, which is great news!
Posts.Title: Sister in England in hospital with cellulitis
Sister in England in hospital with cellulitis

Posts.Content:
Holiday greetings to everyone!  My little sister in England (I posted about
 her back in the spring/summer) is battling an infection in her breast.  She had radiation treatment in May/June and had severe burns and chafing.  She was put on antibiotics in August when they initially diagnosed the infection, but the swelling and soreness hasn't gone away, so the specialist put her back onto them again yesterday and said to come back in three months.
Posts.Title: Infection question

Posts.Content: Hi, everyone: I'm the one with the sister in England who underwent radiation in June.  Well, after quite a long healing period her breast is suddenly hot and red again and she's quite uncomfortable.  Also, the swelling from the treatment never went down.  Has anyone had this problem? She's seeing the specialist again on Sept 21st.  Should she wait or should she go sooner?  Thanks so much for any advice.
Posts.Title: Radiation after-effect?

Posts.Content:
Hello again, everyone: I posted about
 6 weeks ago to tell you about
 my sister in England.  She has been having radiation for the past two weeks and is doing very well so far; the only side effect is a tender nipple; the breast care nurse recommended she sew a piece of silk inside her bra, and that has helped.  She won't need chemo.  I am heading over there the day of her last treatment to take her away to relax for a few days, as we were told she may be tired by then.  Anyone out there who had radiation, no chemo?  If so, were you tired at the end of your treatments?
Posts.Title: Update on sister in England

Posts.Content: Hello, everyone: I used to post regularly on the Crohn's Disease forum, but am happily in remission now after surgery 6 years ago.  I really appreciated the help I got over the years at HealingWell, and now I need your help for my sister.
Posts.Title: Sister just diagnosed in England
